items.q: Which of these is not an ape?
items.explanation: Monkeys generally have tails; apes do not.

items.q: Human hair and nails are made from the same protein.
items.explanation: They are both composed primarily of keratin.
Sharks have skeletons made of cartilage, not bone.
Acorns are the nuts of oak trees.

items.q: What do we call animals that live both in water and on land?
items.explanation: Frogs and toads are classic examples.

items.q: What connects our muscles to our bones?
items.explanation: Tendons transmit the mechanical force of muscle contraction to the bones.
The urinary bladder collects waste from the kidneys.

items.q: What is the natural habitat of a polar bear?
items.explanation: They live in parts of the Arctic region.

items.q: How many days does a caterpillar typically spend as a pupa before it becomes a butterfly?
items.a: Around 1 to 2 weeks (Varies widely depending on species)
items.explanation: The exact time changes based on the species and temperature.

items.q: What do we call animals that sleep during the day and are active at night?
items.explanation: Owls and bats are common nocturnal animals.
